snippet: In “A Night With Janis Joplin,” Mary Bridget Davies brings a positively uncanny vocal impersonation, interspersed with some quieter reflections, to Broadway.
abstract: Charles Isherwood reviews tribute Broadway musical A Night With Janis Joplin, written and directed by Randy Johnson and starring Mary Bridget Davies at Lyceum Theater.
lead_paragraph: In “A Night With Janis Joplin,” Mary Bridget Davies brings a positively uncanny vocal impersonation, interspersed with some quieter reflections, to Broadway.

headline.seo: ‘A Night With Janis Joplin’ Opens on Broadway
headline.main: Little Girl Blue Howls Again, but Talks Sensibly, Too
headline.print_headline: Little Girl Blue Howls Again, But Talks Sensibly, Too
headline.kicker: Theater Review | 'A Night With Janis Joplin'
